snippet: This year’s French Open has been a throwback. In the Round of 16, there were eight men using one-handed backhands, including Roger Federer.
abstract: One-handed backhand is said to be fading from tennis, but 2013 French Open has been a throwback, with eight men employing shot in Round of 16, Roger Federer being among them.
lead_paragraph: This year’s French Open has been a throwback. In the Round of 16, there were eight men using one-handed backhands, including Roger Federer.

headline.seo: French Open: One-Handed Backstroke Prevalent in Men’s Round of 16
headline.main: On Way Out? A Backhand Still Very In
headline.print_headline: On Way Out? A Backhand Still Very In
